channel.description: Recent content in Projects on zyanchew

item.title: Master's Graduation Project
item.description:
üìçTitle: Synthesizing Social Networks for Travel Behavior Models

This research explores the use of Bayesian Belief Networks (BBNs) to synthesize social networks and it’s strength for further integration into travel behavior models. The study focuses on understanding how socio-demographic factors and social relationships influence joint activity participation.

üí° Key Findings

  • Individuals with larger networks of friends are more likely to engage in activities such as dining out.
  • Those with more siblings in their networks tend to take family vacations more often.
  • People are more likely to visit or host friends compared to colleagues.

These findings highlight the importance of both the size and the nature of social relationships in shaping mobility behavior.

item.title: Human Mobility Challenge 2023
item.description:
üìç Human Mobility Prediction Challenge 2023

The challenge involved using a synthetic human mobility dataset to train a deep learning model for predicting future mobility trajectories. The tasks are divided into two scenarios, business-as-usual and under emergency.

üí° Reflections

Participating in the Human Mobility Predictions Challenge 2023 was a valuable learning experience.
It allowed me to:

  • Enhance my coding skills, particularly in Python and machine learning frameworks.
  • Apply machine learning techniques to predict mobility trajectories in different scenarios.
  • Deepen my understanding of neural network mechanisms and explore their theoretical underpinnings.

üìà Results

item.title: Bachelor's Graduation Project
item.description:
üìçTitle: Dynamic Accessibility Measurement Using Human Mobility Big Data

This project was conducted as part of my bachelor’s graduation thesis, focusing on analyzing human mobility data to evaluate accessibility changes during extreme events. By examining mobility patterns before, during, and after a hurricane, this study aims to reveal community resilience and recovery trends.

üìå Key Takeaway
This study demonstrates how mobility data and data-driven approaches can offer valuable insights into infrastructure resilience and inform disaster preparedness strategies.
